Eu sou um pai de 45 anos, provavelmente uma das pessoas mais velhas a jogar este jogo. Sou pai solteiro criando meu filho, que agora tem 14 anos. Meu filho ganhou este jogo no Natal de 2021 de seu tio, então o instalamos em seu computador e ele começou a jogar. Até o final da semana ele tinha 24 horas neste jogo. Isso foi horrível para mim, pois já era difícil encontrar maneiras de passar o tempo com meu filho, pois ele está sempre com os amigos ou apenas assistindo ao YouTube. Então eu decidi fazer uma conta no Battle.net e pegar esse jogo para ver se eu poderia jogar ao lado dele. Eu comprei o jogo, escolhi minha skin e mundo e comecei a jogar, mas eu estava preso no que você deveria fazer. Pedi ajuda ao meu filho e ele organizou um jogo para eu participar. Adorei, pois foi o melhor momento que passei com meu filho desde que minha esposa morreu. Desde então, esse jogo aproximou eu e meu filho novamente e agora passamos um tempo juntos fora de casa também. Este jogo me lembrou que há diversão em tudo, e trouxe muitas lembranças felizes para mim e meu filho. Uma pena a empresa ter estragado o jogo.

Leaving the game open long enough on Steam to leave a negative review. 

Seriously though, if you don't have money to spend on games and you've exhausted every other option, go ahead, waste time on this dumpster fire. Blizz took away OW1 from those of us that paid for it back when and now we're left with a inferior product 'for free'. The lootboxes from before sucked, sure, but you got one per level and could unlock everything from just playing. Now you must sink more time than reasonable into a product that doesn't respect your time to get any kind of result. 

AVOID THIS GAME AND BLIZZARD IN GENERAL, THIS COMPANY DOESN'T RESPECT YOUR TIME OR MONEY.

This review is gonna be short and sweet. 

The game is good. Amazing, even. Fluid gameplay, great artstyle, fun characters. There are[i] very [/i]few games that feel as good to play as Overwatch does. 

Now yes, the monetisation is annoying, and Blizzard has had terrible communication with it's plans for OW2. But this isn't a review of the company or it's business model. It's a review of the game. OW is only following in the footsteps of the entire gaming industry so that it can survive. Does that make it a bad game? Who knows, but for now, you'll never find another game like it

Glad that everything promised is in there!

Having pre-ordered the game since launch, it's been quite a few years with Overwatch. I've had some good memories, and obviously some bad ones. Overwatch had great potential, and the spark of joy when playing it at launch was fantastic. But unfortunately, the developers have stripped the game's potential away, milking it heavily and under delivering on their promises.

The entire premise of OW2 was scrapped within a year of the making, yet they took several years, ignored their first game for it, and then went back on several promises. It was entirely made just to add a few maps, 3 heroes, remove several maps, and remove the method of obtaining skins for free, instead opting for a paid currency for the majority of skins, and a battle pass system as well. 

The worst part is the PVE - the trailers showed such fantastic ideas which were already finished development - talent trees, upgraded abilities, environmental interaction like knocking robots into walls/other robots, and even having enemies with limbs that you could shoot off, impacting their capabilities. While I understand that some of this may have been a bit ambitious, they pulled the worst possible move and delivered none after years of expectations.

I can't recommend this game anymore, not for the gameplay (which while it had its issues across several seasons has been fun for the most part), but for the horrible business decisions of the company, clearly not valuing their playerbase.

I'll miss you Jet Set Radio Frog, but luckily I have Bomb Rush Cyberfunk coming out soon anyways.

Even the tutorial for Team Fortress 2 was way better than just WASD, mouse 1 (shoot badguys),  mouse 2 (ability), shift (run button), e (heal), ultimate (hold m1 to kill enemies no aim required), and capture a point by standing on it with no danger in sight. I learned so much from that thanks Blizzard Entertainment, Inc.!  Blizzard Entertainment, Inc. has shown that they have not learned from the 16 years of greatness that is Team Fortress 2, the best sequel of all time.
Team Fortress 2 > Overwatch 2.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game online a month ago, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

[h1] 为我人生中投入最多的FPS MOBA致哀 [/h1]
仍旧没有什么游戏能替代OW1，即便是它的2代
一、阉割的PVE，买了却无法添加到账户的DLC，所以动暴你们升级这个2代到底升级了个什么？开2不就是为了能兼容天赋树、剧情分支？后来说这些东西超纲了！做不出来了！那继续保持1代啊，退版本多好！
二、2代“升级”了操作手感，让武器音效更加拟真，给我的感觉像是每一把武器都变沉重了，比以前更难瞄准，如果放在10年前我十七八岁时我或许能很快适应，但现在我是可怜的二十七岁，音效这类东西也会有人不适应突变，如果有能选择武器音效包，那还好些。
三、一些一代存在的老BUG现在依然存在，好友在线未隐身但游戏内好友列表显示离线、小队所有人都进入语音，但显示只有自己在语音里，同时能听到队友的声音，但左上角没有发言图标、没有开启什么隐私设置，正常在线没有隐身，但好友却无法邀请自己，每次邀请都显示“未找到该玩家”……
商人的眼光终究脱离不了“赚钱”二字，1代几乎所有内容都可以免费获取，新英雄、新模式、皮肤、胜利姿势、动作表情、喷漆。而这些东西到了2代，全都收费，还是近乎天价。自己贪财不讲基本的诚信那就怪不得别人指责。
回首2016年底，就要大学毕业的我在几个前高中同学的呼唤中买下了国服OW1，当时从CS滚过来的我并没有见识过这种主打技能、配合的FPS之新奇，几乎有时间去网吧都会摸几局，别管打的有多菜，你就说快不快乐吧。断断续续，走走停停，如梦如醉。时间来到了2018，2代的立项和新CG把我拉回我弃坑已久的游戏中，我也把更多的时间投入到国服的OW1中。
而现在，国服关了，1最后的辉煌也不再，OW的亲生父母已经被挤走，剩下了只想拿这个可怜孩子赚钱的路灯挂件罢了。

Review negativa hasta que dejen de ser unos ladrones a mano armada y mentirosos con sus usuarios. 20 USD una skin, 10 USD para el pase de batalla, el cual te trae 1500 monedas con las que sólo se pueden comprar cosméticos de OW 1, otros 15 USD para jugar unas misiones que duran media hora LMAO, los nuevos héroes se consiguen instantáneamente si pagás el pase de batalla, pero si no, preparate para farmear hasta nivel 45 para tenerlo, lo que puede considerarse pay to win ya que el que pagó puede usar el héroe mucho antes que el que no.

Dijeron que iban a hacer tremenda campaña PVE, que iba a haber árboles de habilidades y que por eso cambiaron de engine (ya que en OW 1 supuestamente no se podía y por eso abandonaron el juego), para después decantarse por "Al final no lo vamos a hacer sorry!!! :p :p"

Otra cosa que me molesta es que quieran promover que son inclusivos y no sé qué cuando sus trabajadores literalmente les robaban la leche materna a sus empleadas y demás cosas horribles (esto se puede googlear fácilmente), en fin, me molesta la hipocresía y la caradurez con la que se manejan.
